chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-12-22

Defendant Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request. Case remains in resolution posture, defendant has pending matter 21CM773 and 21CM774. Court will accept defendant's pending misdemeanors for a possible global resolution from Branch 15.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Court accepts the two cases from Branch 19, 21CM773 & 21CM774, for global resolution.  Defendant given court slip with next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper in court, appear by video with attorney Jason A Findling, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 7, 2022 - received
JusticePoint Violation Report dated June 3, 2022 - received

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sanjuan Shaquille Cooper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
